Not all of my samples need to be processed together. This script will make the appropriate subset files. First, read in the new data

```{r readdata}
countData <- read.csv("../data/rnaseq/countbygene.csv", header=T, check.names = F, row.names = T)
colData <- read.csv("../data/rnaseq/kallistosamples.csv", header=T)
rownames(kallistosamples.csv) <- kallistosamples.csv$RNAseqID
```

## Subset for the dissociation experiment
Here, I'm selection only homecage or control samples. The output will be sent the the folder for just the dissociation experiment 

```{r dissociation}
colData <- colData %>%
  filter(Group %in% c("homecage", "control")) %>%
  filter(Conflict != "NoConflict")
savecols <- as.character(colData$RNAseqID) #selects all good samples
savecols <- as.vector(savecols) # make it a vector
countdata <- countdata %>% select(one_of(savecols)) # keep good samples
```
